com.rrbrussell.enigma_demonstration

Class SteckerBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rrbrussell.enigma_demonstration.SteckerBoard

  • public class SteckerBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the plugboard or Steckerboard used by the Enigma machine to swap characters before and after encipherment by the rotors
    Author:
    Robert R. Russell

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] Board 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SteckerBoard()
      Creates an empty SteckerBoard
      SteckerBoard(java.lang.String Pairings)
      Creates a SteckerBoard with pairs of characters connected.

    • Field Detail

      • Board

        private int[] Board

    • Constructor Detail

      • SteckerBoard

        public SteckerBoard()
        Creates an empty SteckerBoard

      • SteckerBoard

        public SteckerBoard(java.lang.String Pairings)
        Creates a SteckerBoard with pairs of characters connected.
        Parameters:
        Pairings - A space delimited string of pairs of characters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - May be thrown for:
        • Not following the definition of a pair
        • Adding a character to a second pair
        • Pairing a character with itself
        • Trying to add more than ten pairings.

    • Method Detail

      • Encipher

        public int Encipher(int Plaintext)
        Perform the Encipherment based on current SteckerBoard settings.
        Parameters:
        Plaintext -
        Returns:
        Ciphertext
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Plaintext is outside 0 && Rotor.Ringsize - 1.

      • AddSwaping

        public boolean AddSwaping(int First,
                 int Second)
        May not remain public:

        Used to create a swapping between characters.

        Parameters:
        First - First Character in the swapping
        Second - Second Character in the swapping
        Returns:
        True if one of the two characters in already in a pairing.
